item.title: Diabetes XGBoost testing
item.description: Steps Load the “diabetes.csv” dataset using Pandas ✓ Split the data into 80% for training and 20% for testing ✓ Train an XG-Boost classifier model using SK-Learn Library ✓ Assess trained model performance ✓ Plot the confusion matrix ✓ Print the classification report ✓ Before beginning, I am using RStudio meaning loading R’s reticulate library is first. library(reticulate) Now, import all of the required Python libraries. import pandas as pd import numpy as np import seaborn as sns import matplotlib.

Dataset

The dataset for this project is from Kaggle. You know the deal, load the R python library and necessary python packages, load the csv into a pandas dataframe.

item.title: Dataset Database Listing
item.description: This is simply a list of all of the websites I use to get the data for the topics that I come across. The list includes both open-source and commercial datasets. Data.gov is a data source for United States governmental data. With over 250,000 datasets, there is a lot to choose from. Census.gov is a data source regarding infrastructure, economics, commercial investments, and so much more. Google Cloud, as of this post, has just over 200 free datasets available.
